title: Great Work Culture, Sour End
pros: - I worked within a great department. The marketing team and our supervisors (Katie, Susan, and Nicole) provided great support annd encouragement to our department. Even during challenging times, especially during budget buts and company-wide layoffs, it felt like we were able to communicate any struggles with our supervisors and were met with the appropriate support. - The benefits and company culture made the corporate employees feel appreciated. While the workload could be rigorous during certain seasons of peak projects, the effort didn’t go unnoticed.
cons: - Unfortunately, Veris and HR specifically has a lot of growing to do when it comes to handling situations involving ADA/disabilities. My accommodations request was treated with a lot of disrespect and unethical practice. After medical leave and what turned into a contentious battle with HR, I was unable to return to work. - There was a lot of tension between certain departments while others worked very closely. It almost felt clique-y depending on which department you were a part of/worked with. - There was an obvious disconnect between the corporate teams and on-site teams. The company would do well to bring both worlds together for a more collaborative environment.

title: Good Benefits and Sustainability Efforts, but Work Environment Can Be Tough
pros: Great Benefits: The benefits package is solid, covering health, dental, vision, and more. Industry Leader in Sustainability: Veris is strong in sustainability, which is a plus if you care about environmental issues. Good Training Program: They provide decent training programs with quarterly sessions to help you stay updated. Supportive Co-workers: Most colleagues are friendly and supportive, fostering a sense of teamwork. Nice Locations and Offices: The offices are well-maintained and located in pleasant areas. Commission Opportunities: There are opportunities to earn commissions, which can help boost your income.
cons: Inconsistent Work Environment: Your experience largely depends on your management team. Some managers are great, but others can make the work environment difficult. Office Open 7 Days a Week: Mandatory weekends make it hard to achieve a good work-life balance. Frequent Tech Issues: We often have to learn new technologies and software, which frequently crash and cause more problems. Clique Culture: There’s a noticeable clique culture, which can make it challenging to fit in. Frequent Layoffs: The company has frequent layoffs, leading to a sense of instability and uncertainty.
